text: SASC voted to report the nomination of Gen. Dunford for reappointment as Chairman of @thejointstaff. Nomination now goes to Senate floor.
Tonight the Senate re-confirmed Gen. Dunford as Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
Tune in at 10 AM ET to SASC hearing on US strategy for Afghanistan & S. Asia w/ Secretary Mattis & Chairman Dunford https://t.co/ZNgDU0RLMk
Tune in now: SASC hearing on US strategy for Afghanistan & S. Asia with Secretary Mattis and Chairman Dunford https://t.co/ZNgDU0RLMk
The Senate has voted to confirm David Trachtenberg to be @DeptofDefense Principal Deputy Under Secretary Of Defense For Policy.
The Senate has agreed to the motion to go to conference on the #FY18NDAA and named all SASC members as conferees.
Today at 10AM (note time change) SASC holds DOD nominations hearing for Esper, Wilkie, Kernan, and Roberts. Tune in: https://t.co/OxEODY22CQ
The Senate voted 91-7 to confirm the nomination of John H. Gibson II to be Deputy Chief Management Officer of the @DeptofDefense.
Today the SASC voted by voice vote to report 4 @DeptofDefense nominations to the Senate floor: Esper, Wilkie, Kernan, and Roberts.
SASC & HASC complete conference on #FY18NDAA. SASC summary available here: https://t.co/DIH8hpKgUo
Beginning now: SASC hearing on four @DeptofDefense nominations. Watch live: https://t.co/uHKa1pPBgw
Today the SASC voted by voice vote to report the following @DeptofDefense nominations to the Senate floor: Behler, Modly, and Geurts.
The full text of the Conference Report for the National Defense Authorization Act is now available: https://t.co/CteB9Beij0 #FY18NDAA
SASC is holding a hearing on three @DeptofDefense nominees: Kurta, McPherson, and Maggs. Watch live - https://t.co/hkrgmPsOfk
Today the SASC voted by voice vote to report the following @DeptofDefense nominations to the Senate floor: McMahon, James, Jette, and Manasco.
Today the Senate confirmed Mark Esper to be Secretary of the Army by a vote of 89-6 .
Today the SASC voted by voice vote to report the following @DeptofDefense nominations to the Senate floor: Kurta, McPherson, and Maggs.

Today the Senate passed the conference report for the #FY18NDAA, which supports a total defense budget of $700 billion and provides our men and women in uniform with the resources, training, and equipment they need to protect our nation.
Today the Senate voted to confirm the following @DeptofDefense nominees: Wilkie, Kernan, Roberts, Behler, Modly, Geurts, McMahon, and Manasco.

At 10:30 AM ET SASC will hold a hearing with defense experts on recommendations for the National Defense Strategy. The #FY17NDAA requires the SecDef to craft an NDS to set a strategy to achieve warfighting superiority over our adversaries. Watch live: https://t.co/LJcvX4GQWB

The Committee just voted to report the nominations of John Rood to be Under Secretary of Defense for Policy and Randall Schriver to be Assistant Secretary of Defense for Asian & Pacific Affairs, along with 275 military nominations.
The @ReaganDefense Forum is kicking off at the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library in California. Watch live here: https://t.co/DdZkri5geC #RNDF https://t.co/kgKUTdLODQ

At 10 AM ET, SASC will hold a heading on @DeptofDefense acquainted reform efforts. Witnesses will be AT&L Under Sec Lord, @SecArmy Esper, @SecAFOfficial Wilson, and  Navy Asst Sec Geurts. Watch live: https://t.co/pgXgDjrriS

The President just signed into law the #FY18NDAA, which authorizes the resources and policies necessary for our service members to do the jobs we ask of them and keep our nation safe. Thanks to all members of the SASC and HASC for their hard work on this bipartisan bill.

Watch live now as the SASC holds a hearing on U.S. policy and strategy in the Middle East with four former Ambassadors who together have over a century of experience as diplomats and national security policymakers focused on the region: https://t.co/Eg43dHdAyF
Tonight the Senate voted to confirm John Rood to be Undersecretary of Defense for Policy.
Last night the Senate passed a resolution naming @SenatorTimScott as the newest member of the Senate Armed Services Committee. Welcome aboard, Senator Scott!
Happening now: SASC hearing on DOD nominations. Watch live - https://t.co/Ka9zVQZsIT

Happening soon - SASC hearing on global challenges and U.S. national security strategy with former Secretaries of State Henry Kissinger and George Shultz and former Deputy Secretary of State Richard Armitage. Watch live at 10 AM ET: https://t.co/qo8Rbro8UF
Happening now: SASC hearing on the situation on the Korean Peninsula and U.S. strategy in the Indo-Pacific region. Watch live - https://t.co/CImOP3lM6m

Today the SASC voted to report the following @DeptofDefense nominations: Paul Ney, Kevin Fahey, Thomas Ayres, and Lisa Gordon-Hagerty. All nominations were reported to the Senate floor following the Committee’s action.

Today the SASC voted to favorably report nomination of Lt Gen Paul Nakasone to be Commander of U.S. Cyber Command, Director of the National Security Agency, and Chief of the Central Security Service. The nomination was immediately reported to the Senate floor.

Today the SASC voted to favorably report the nomination of Dr. Brent Park to be Deputy Administrator for Defense Nuclear Nonproliferation of the NNSA. The nomination was immediately reported to the Senate floor following the Committee’s action.

The nomination of Anne Marie White to be Assistant Secretary of Energy for Environmental Management was automatically discharged out of the SASC on March 1, 2018, pursuant to the order of June 28, 1990. The nomination now awaits action on the Senate floor.

Tune in now for SASC's hearing on the security situation in Europe and the posture of U.S. European Command with General Curtis Scaparrotti, EUCOM Commander and NATO Supreme Allied Commander Europe - https://t.co/j6l5Z7zieC
Today's Strategic Forces Subcommittee hearing on ballistic missile defense will be postponed.
Today's Seapower Subcommittee hearing on Navy shipbuilding will be postponed.
Today SASC will hold a hearing on challenges in the Department of @ENERGY atomic energy defense programs with @SecretaryPerry. Watch at 10 AM ET: https://t.co/SdPZFIh64p

Tune in now for SASC'S hearing on the posture of U.S. Transportation Command with General Darren McDew, USAF:
https://t.co/owQVapy7ai

Tune in now for SASC’s hearing on @USNavy & @USMC posture with SECNAV Spencer, CNO ADM Richardson, & USMC
Commandant GEN Neller. Watch live: https://t.co/SoQzUsk3WX
Tune in now for SASC's hearing on the posture of the @USAirForce with @SecAFOfficial Heather Wilson and USAF Chief Of Staff @GenDaveGoldfein. Watch live: https://t.co/Vpc77frSJ9

Today SASC voted to favorably report 256 pending military nominations, including ADM Philip Davidson to be Commander of U.S. Pacific Command and
GEN Terrence O’Shaughnessy to be Commander of U.S. Northern Command and NORAD. All nominations now move to the Senate floor.

At 9:30 ET, tune in for SASC's hearing on @DeptofDefense FY19 budget request and Future Years Defense Program with witnesses Secretary of Defense Mattis, Under Secretary Norquist (Comptroller), and @thejointstaff Chairman GEN Dunford. Watch here: https://t.co/VI2kFXGpAY
SASC announces #FY19NDAA markup schedule: subcommittees May 21-22 (https://t.co/FOo4pvvkhM) & full committee May 23-25 (https://t.co/TZ0ytprCD6).
Happening now: SASC hearing on five @DeptofDefense nominations -- Dr. Lisa Porter, Mr. James Stewart, Dr. James Anderson, and Mr. Gregory Slavonic. Watch live: https://t.co/4dN55qs0y7

SASC today announced details of the markup of the John S. McCain #FY19NDAA. After considering and adopting more than 300 amendments, the committee voted overwhelmingly to advance the bill. A summary is available here: https://t.co/otRBGJGyAU

This week SASC voted to report 280 military nominations and the following civilian nominations: Lisa Porter, James Stewart, James Anderson, Gregory Slavonic, Charles Verdon, & Charles Stimson. Last night the Senate confirmed Mr. Slavonic & the military nominations.
Text of the John S. McCain #FY19NDAA is available here: https://t.co/QlMmVWXJ4c
The report to accompany the John S. McCain #FY19NDAA (S. Rpt. 115-262) has been posted: https://t.co/UXOI7dyZi8
Tonight the Senate passed the John S. McCain National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2019 by a vote of 85-10.

The #FY19NDAA conferees will meet tomorrow to formally begin the conference process. SASC and HASC leaders will host a brief, joint media availability prior to the meeting at 2:20PM outside SD-G50. https://t.co/VRZBpqdA9l
Senate and House Armed Services Committees Complete Conference on #FY19NDAA https://t.co/bqlPbk9ME2
The Conference Report to accompany the John S. McCain #FY19NDAA (H. Rept. 115-863) has been posted: https://t.co/c3si9JSVnm. The Joint Explanatory Statement is available here: https://t.co/d0kkiyR38m

Today the Senate passed the conference report for the John S. McCain #FY19NDAA by by an overwhelming, bipartisan vote of 87-10. The text of the report, explanatory statement, and committee summary are available here: https://t.co/bqlPbk9ME2
